alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Hampden; Hampshire (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 19 at 2:33PM EST until February 19 at 3:30PM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Boston/Norton has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Hampshire County in western Massachusetts... Franklin County in western Massachusetts... Western Hampden County in western Massachusetts... * Until 330 PM EST. * At 231 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Florida to near Stanfordville, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts up to 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * Interstates 90 and 91 in Western Massachusetts. Locations impacted include... Springfield, Chicopee, Westfield, Holyoke, Amherst, Northampton, Agawam, West Springfield, Greenfield, Deerfield, Ludlow, South Hadley, Easthampton, Longmeadow, East Longmeadow, Belchertown, Wilbraham, Monroe, Southwick and Montague. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.
